channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump to announce an executive order against social media companies
GOP operatives worry Trump will lose both the presidency and Senate majority
item.description: A little more than three months ago, as Democrats cast their ballots in the Nevada caucuses, Republicans felt confident about their chances in 2020. The coronavirus seemed a distant, far-off threat. Democrats appeared poised to nominate a self-described socialist for president. The stock market was near a record high. The economy was roaring. President Donald Trump looked well-positioned to win a second term, and perhaps pull enough incumbent Republicans along with him to hold the party's majority in the Senate.

item.title: Trump mocks journalist for wearing mask
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta reports that President Trump is stoking a "culture war" over not wearing masks, mocking Reuters White House correspondent Jeff Mason for wearing one at a press briefing.

item.title: Outrage grows over the killing of George Floyd as protesters clash with police
item.description: Two days after the death of an unarmed black man at the hands of a police officer, protesters marched in the streets of at least three major US cities.

item.title: Watch 'chaos' at looted Target in Minneapolis
item.description: As heated protests over George Floyd's death continue in Minneapolis, CNN's Sara Sidner shows the 'chaotic' scenes as people looted Target and other local businesses.

item.title: New generation of hungry locusts threatens millions
Some countries clap for medical workers. But not here
item.description: Frontline medical workers in the US, the UK and elsewhere may face major risks in their efforts to battle the coronavirus pandemic, but they've also seen an outpouring of public appreciation. In Russia, health workers say they face fear, mistrust -- and even open hostility.

item.title: WHO says Covid-19 caused 159,000 excess deaths in 24 European countries
She posted about equipment shortages. Now, she fears for her job
item.description: Doctors in Russia are facing distrust as they battle the Covid-19 pandemic. CNN's Matthew Chance explores why.

item.title: Death of 14-year-old girl in 'honor killing' sparks outrage
item.description: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani has called for new protections for women after a 14-year-old girl was allegedly murdered by her father in a so-called "honor killing," sparking outrage in the country.

item.title: China's legislature approves national security law for Hong Kong that critics say threatens freedoms
China's defense budget shows Xi's priorities as economy tightens
item.description: When China announced a 6.6% increase in its military budget last week while cutting substantially in other areas, analysts said it made one thing clear: Beijing senses an increasing security threat and is giving the People's Liberation Army the military muscle to deal with it.

item.title: Judge in rape case removed after asking accuser if she 'closed her legs
item.description: A New Jersey Superior Court judge was removed from his position after several misconduct claims, including because he asked an alleged rape victim how she tried to stop an assault.

item.title: India has an unlikely new type of period health educators: men
item.description: There's no trash can in the cramped washroom shared by almost 200 women at the congested Banjara Basti slum in Thane, a satellite city near Mumbai.

item.title: WH press secretary reacts to information revealing her voting history
item.description: White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany is defending her record of mail-in voting as President Trump continues to criticize absentee ballots. CNN's Jim Acosta reports.

item.title: Fox News looks the other way as US passes 100,000 deaths
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: America's awful economy in the first quarter was even worse than we thought
item.description: America's economy fared worse than initially reported in the first quarter, according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis.

item.title: Boris Johnson adviser Dominic Cummings may have breached lockdown rules, police say
item.description: Boris Johnson's embattled chief aide Dominic Cummings may have broken the UK's coronavirus rules by driving to a castle town during lockdown, British police have concluded, heaping further pressure on the Prime Minister to change his position and sack his adviser.

item.title: Two major US airlines prepare for potentially massive layoffs
item.description: Plummeting demand for travel has forced two major US carriers — Delta Air Lines and American Airlines — to gut their workforces through voluntary exit programs and layoffs.

item.title: Fauci says second coronavirus wave is possible, but "not inevitable"
Man who hung effigy of Kentucky's governor from a tree has been fired
item.description: The man who hung an effigy of Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear on a tree outside the Kentucky state Capitol on Sunday, has been fired from his job.

item.title: A woman said she saw a wolverine on a Washington state beach. Officials didn't believe her
item.description: When a woman told a wildlife official she thought she'd seen a wolverine on the beach of Washington state's Long Beach Peninsula they didn't believe her.

item.title: Largest all-electric aircraft to make maiden flight
item.description: As concerns over the environmental cost of flying continue to mount, green propulsion systems can offer an ethical alternative.

item.title: Teen rescued trying to cross New Zealand's South and North Islands in dinghy at night
item.description: An 18-year-old who tried to cross New Zealand's Cook Strait in a motorized dinghy was rescued by police on Thursday morning after the dinghy broke down in perilous waters at night.

item.title: No screaming, please: Japan amusement parks issue new Covid-19 guidelines
item.description: Thrill seekers in Japan will soon get to enjoy their favorite roller coasters again now that amusement parks around the country are reopening.

item.title: UConn senior suspected of killing 2 and leading a six-day manhunt was arrested
item.description: The University of Connecticut student accused of killing two people, kidnapping another and leading police on a six-day manhunt was arrested in Maryland on Wednesday, authorities said.

item.title: Imagine giving up your child. This mother is considering it
item.description: Thousands of migrant domestic workers are stranded in Lebanon now jobless, penniless and some homeless with no way out as coronavirus exacerbates the country's economic crisis. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports.

item.title: Las Vegas is reopening in one week
item.description: Detailed housekeeping checklists. Half-empty casinos. Reservations-only dining. No shows, nightclubs or sporting events. These are just some of the realities that travelers can expect when Las Vegas reopens for tourist traffic next week.

item.title: Disney CEO explains why it's safe to go back to Disney World
item.description: Disney World is set to reopen, but is it safe to return to the "most magical place on earth"?

item.title: What you can and can't do when Walt Disney World reopens
item.description: The Disney theme park plans to begin a phased reopening on July 11 for its Magic Kingdom parks and July 15 for EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. CNN's Natasha Chen explains how the parks are taking precautions to guard against the coronavirus.

item.title: Katy Perry shows off baby bump in new photos
item.description: Katy Perry used the space launch delay to talk about another bump.

item.title: Netflix isn't sending any films or talent to festivals this awards season
item.description: Netflix will not participate in the festival circuit this season.

item.title: Prince William reveals how his poor eyesight helped with nerves when public speaking
item.description: Prince William is trying to get men to open up about their mental health, and for a new documentary on the issue he revealed his own unorthodox way of managing his nerves.

item.title: How to safely go on a summer vacation during the coronavirus era
item.description: When the coronavirus pandemic hit and borders closed all over the world, BreAnne Henry scrapped her plans for a summer trip to Ireland and Portugal.

item.title: 'Exceedingly rare' cognac from 1762 fetches $146,000 at auction
item.description: A cognac from a 1762 vintage sold for £118,580 ($146,000) at an online auction on Thursday.

item.title: English Premier League will resume season on June 17, reports say
item.description: The English Premier League season will resume without fans attending on June 17, according to multiple reports, including The Telegraph and Sky Sports.

item.title: How will we party post-pandemic?
item.description: In nightclubs around the world, once-crowded dance floors have remained empty for months. If you need reminding, clubbing is close contact activity: People share drinks, hug, kiss and generally invade each others personal space until the early hours of the morning.

item.title: The F1 star swapping life in the fast lane for the farm
item.description: Formula One played its own version of musical chairs after Sebastian Vettel revealed he was leaving Ferrari earlier this month.

item.title: App lets fans cheer from home and be heard in stadiums
item.description: Due to Covid-19, crowds are not being allowed inside stadiums during sporting events. Now an app lets fans cheer and boo from home. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: Lockdown art will be turned into murals in the United Arab Emirates
item.description: With people around the world trapped inside due to coronavirus lockdowns, some have turned to art to express their feelings during this tumultuous time.

item.title: Ai Weiwei has turned his most iconic artworks into charity face masks
item.description: Ai Weiwei has produced a series of face masks printed with his most iconic artworks to help counter the "humanitarian crisis" arising from Covid-19.

item.title: Nail-biting video shows bear following boy during a family hike
item.description: An Italian boy named Alessandro was captured on video while he was being followed by a brown bear during a hike with his family.

item.title: The latest on the George Floyd case
These are the images of George Floyd you should see
item.description: George Floyd moved to Minnesota "to be his best self," as one friend put it.

item.title: Tearful CNN commentator: There's just so much pain
item.description: CNN political commentator Bakari Sellers reacts to the death of George Floyd after he was pinned down by police in Minneapolis.

item.title: University of Minnesota will scale back ties with Minneapolis police after George Floyd's death
item.description: The University of Minnesota, whose main campus is in Minneapolis, has announced it will scale back the relationship it has with Minneapolis police following the death of George Floyd.

item.title: How do I make sure I'm not raising a racist kid?
item.description: It's easy for white folks to recoil from Amy Cooper once we've had a front row seat to her rage-filled voice turning trembly and fragile when the 911 operator picks up.

item.title: China approves controversial Hong Kong security law
New generation of hungry locusts threatens millions
Trump set to announce executive order against social media companies
item.description: President Donald Trump is set to announce an executive order against social media companies on Thursday, White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany told reporters aboard Air Force One on the return flight to Washington following NASA's aborted SpaceX launch.
